definition:
Let $X$ be a locally compact Hausdorff topological space with Borel
$\sigma$–algebra $\mathcal{B}$, and suppose $\mu$ is a measure on
$(X,\mathcal{B})$. For any Borel set $B \in \mathcal{B}$, the measure
$\mu$ is said to be [*outer regular*]{} on $B$ if
$$\mu(B) = \inf\,\{ \mu(U) \mid U \supset B,\ U\ \rm{open} \}.$$ We say
$\mu$ is [*inner regular*]{} on $B$ if
$$\mu(B) = \sup\,\{ \mu(K) \mid K \subset B,\ K\ \rm{compact} \}.$$
